get.description: A simple endpoint for testing your connection to the Ardoq server.

rootWorkspace.title: Workspace ID of Reference's `source` Component
rootWorkspace.description: This is a read-only field maintained by the backend to simplify workspace lookups. It is derived from the `source` attribute. A reference's `rootWorkspace` cannot be changed by modifying this attribute.

targetWorkspace.title: Workspace ID of Reference's `target` Component
targetWorkspace.description: This is a read-only field maintained by the backend to simplify workspace lookups. It is derived from the `target` attribute. A reference's `targetWorkspace` cannot be changed by modifying this attribute.

parameters.name: rootWorkspace
parameters.description: The ardoq identifier of the workspace that the reference/source belongs to.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: The ardoq identifier of the source.

parameters.name: targetWorkspace

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: The ardoq identifier of the target.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type identifier of the reference.

get.description:
List all references. Query parameters can be used to retrieve a subset of the collection. All included query parameters are interpreted as forming a logical **conjunction**, meaning that only the references that satisfy every property will be returned. The list endpoint supports searching for custom fields. When searching for a custom field, the value is interpreted based on the type associated with the field. This means that you are not required to _quote_ strings. To include a **custom field** in your search, you should specify the JSON path. For example; if you wanted to search for all references that have the **displayText** "Ardoq" and the **custom field** `my_field` with a boolean value of `true` you would use the query param:

```displayText=Ardoq&customFields.my_field=true```

rootWorkspace.title: Workspace ID of Reference's `source` Component
rootWorkspace.description: This is a read-only field maintained by the backend to simplify workspace lookups. It is derived from the `source` attribute. A reference's `rootWorkspace` cannot be changed by modifying this attribute.

targetWorkspace.title: Workspace ID of Reference's `target` Component
targetWorkspace.description: This is a read-only field maintained by the backend to simplify workspace lookups. It is derived from the `target` attribute. A reference's `targetWorkspace` cannot be changed by modifying this attribute.

shape.title: Component Shape
shape.description: Shape is a style attribute used by the front-end to display the component shape in views like the block diagram. By default this will use the shape defined by the component-type, but can be overriden by setting it explicitly per-component. A list of valid values for this attribute should be found by inspecting the style drop-down in the front-end.

image.description: Image is a style attribute used by the front-end to display the component image in views like the block diagram. By default this will use the image defined by the component-type, but can be overriden by setting it explicitly per-component.

parameters.name: ifVersionMatch
parameters.description:
This parameter is used to manage concurrency control. The value **MUST** be either a positive integer, or the enum `latest`. 
| Value | Meaning |
|--------|---------|
|<nobr>`<integer>`</nobr>| The update **MUST** fail if the `_version` field of the stored entity is not identical to the provided value. |\n|`latest`   | The update should use the current (latest) version of the stored entity. |

For more information about versioning and concurrency control please see the [API guide on Versioning](/api-guides/concepts/versioning/).

rootWorkspace.description: The Ardoq identifier (oid) of the workspace that the component belongs to.

componentKey.title: Ardoq ID
componentKey.description: The component key can be used to uniquely refer to a component in a more human-readable way, and is searchable in the application.

additionalProperties.title: Value
additionalProperties.description: The value of a searchable custom field.

customFields.title: Custom Fields for Aliases
customFields.description: A custom field can uniquely identify an entity in a workspace.

rootWorkspace.title: Workspace ID of Reference's `source` Component
rootWorkspace.description: This is a read-only field maintained by the backend to simplify workspace lookups. It is derived from the `source` attribute. A reference's `rootWorkspace` cannot be changed by modifying this attribute.

source.title: Source Component identifier
source.description: Identify the source component. A component that exists may be identified by an Ardoq Id (oid) or an alias identifier. If the source component is created or upserted in the same batch request, then you must use the `batchId` value associated with that component.

target.title: Target Component identifier
target.description: Identify the target component. A component that exists may be identified by an Ardoq Id (oid) or an alias identifier. If the target component is created or upserted in the same batch request, then you must use the `batchId` value associated with that component.

type.title: Type ID of Reference
type.description: Required type ID for the reference. This ID must be a valid type defined by the model that is used by the `rootWorkspace`.

aliases.title: Aliases
aliases.description: An alias is a user provided string that resolves to an existing component/reference in Ardoq. An alias may be used in place of an Ardoq Id.

rootWorkspace.title: Component's Workspace ID
rootWorkspace.description: The Ardoq identifier (oid) of the workspace that the component belongs to.

shape.title: Component Shape
shape.description: Shape is a style attribute used by the front-end to display the component shape in views like the block diagram. By default this will use the shape defined by the component-type, but can be overriden by setting it explicitly per-component. A list of valid values for this attribute should be found by inspecting the style drop-down in the front-end.

image.title: Component Image
image.description: Image is a style attribute used by the front-end to display the component image in views like the block diagram. By default this will use the image defined by the component-type, but can be overriden by setting it explicitly per-component.

parent.title: Parent Component identifier
parent.description: Identify the parent component. A component that exists may be identified by either its Ardoq Id (oid) or by an alias. If the parent component is created or upserted in the same batch request, then you must use the `batchId` value associated with the parent component.

typeId.title: Component Type Id
typeId.description: Component types are drawn from the type-hierarchy defined by the workspace's metamodel.

color.title: Component Color
color.description: Color is a style attribute used by the front-end to display the component color in views like the block diagram. By default this will use the color defined by the component-type, but can be overriden by setting it explicitly per-component.

post.description: The Batch API lets you combine **create**, **update** and **delete** operations on both components and references belonging to disparate workspaces into a single request. All operations are executed within a transaction. If **any** of the operations fail then the whole request will fail leaving the state of Ardoq unmodified.

parameters.name: ifVersionMatch
parameters.description:
This parameter is used to manage concurrency control. The value **MUST** be either a positive integer, or the enum `latest`. 
| Value | Meaning |
|--------|---------|
|<nobr>`<integer>`</nobr>| The update **MUST** fail if the `_version` field of the stored entity is not identical to the provided value. |\n|`latest`   | The update should use the current (latest) version of the stored entity. |

For more information about versioning and concurrency control please see the [API guide on Versioning](/api-guides/concepts/versioning/).

get.description: Get the overview of a report associated with a given Ardoq Identifier. The overview contains the name, description, and other _meta_ information about the report. The overview does not contain the actual report data.

get.description: List all reports. Query parameters can be used to retrieve a subset of the reports. All included query parameters are interpreted as forming a logical **conjunction**, meaning that only reports that satisfy every property will be returned.

rootWorkspace.title: Workspace Identifier

apiKey.title: Custom Field API Key
apiKey.description: The key used to identify the field when using the API.

label.title: Custom Field Label
label.description: The human readable label for the field. This is the value that you will see when working the Ardoq UI.

defaultValue.title: Default Value
defaultValue.description: The default value for the field.

calculated.title: Calculated field
calculated.description: Calculated fields are **read only** and should not be included in **create** and **update** requests.

readOnly.title: Read Only field
readOnly.description: True if the field can not be updated directly by the user.

description.title: Description
description.description: An optional description of the field.

items.title: List Option
items.description: An valid value for a list like type.

options.title: Options
options.description: The set of allowed values. This field is only present on _list like_ types.

customFields.description: A list of custom fields supported by the reference type.

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: A list of all tags that are available for components and references in this workspace.

schema.description: An overview of the types and fields for the model
schema.title: Workspace Context

get.description: Information required for interacting with entities that belong to the workspace.

items.title: Value
items.description: The type of each column is determined by the underlying query. All values are valid JSON.

items.title: Row
items.description: A row consists of a list of column values

href.title: href
href.description: A URI that can be used to retrieve the next set of paginated results.

next.title: Next
next.description: A link to the next page in a paginated result.

_links.title: Links
_links.description: Links related to the paginated results.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name of report and stored query

label.title: Label
label.description: The column name as displayed in the Ardoq UI.

key.title: key
key.description: The immutable key for the column. This value will never change.

_meta.title: Metadata
_meta.description: Metadata related to the paginated response.

get.description: Run a report associated with a given Ardoq Identifier and return the results in tabular format (list of lists).

rootWorkspace.title: Component's Workspace ID
rootWorkspace.description: The Ardoq identifier (oid) of the workspace that the component belongs to.

shape.title: Component Shape
shape.description: Shape is a style attribute used by the front-end to display the component shape in views like the block diagram. By default this will use the shape defined by the component-type, but can be overriden by setting it explicitly per-component. A list of valid values for this attribute should be found by inspecting the style drop-down in the front-end.

image.title: Component Image
image.description: Image is a style attribute used by the front-end to display the component image in views like the block diagram. By default this will use the image defined by the component-type, but can be overriden by setting it explicitly per-component.

parent.title: Parent ID
parent.description: The Ardoq identifier (oid) of the parent component.

created.title: Time of creation
created.description: A Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) timestamp generated when the entity was created.

createdBy.title: Creator ID
createdBy.description: The internal Ardoq identifier of the user that created the entity.

lastUpdated.title: Last Updated Timestamp
lastUpdated.description: A Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) timestamp generated when the entity was last updated.

lastModifiedBy.title: Updater ID
lastModifiedBy.description: The internal Ardoq identifier of the user that last modified the entity.

createdByEmail.title: Creator Email
createdByEmail.description: The current email address of the user that created the entity.

createdByName.title: Creator name
createdByName.description: The current name of the user that created the entity.

lastModifiedByEmail.title: Updater Email
lastModifiedByEmail.description: The current email address of the user that last modified the entity.

lastModifiedByName.title: Updater Name
lastModifiedByName.description: The current name of the user that last modified the entity.

typeId.title: Component Type Id
typeId.description: Component types are drawn from the type-hierarchy defined by the workspace's metamodel.

type.title: Component Type Name
type.description: The name of the component type.

_id.title: Component ID
_id.description: The unique Ardoq identifier (oid) of the component.

_version.title: Version
_version.description: The current version of the component. Versions are used to resolve contention between different users editing the same entity simultaneously.

componentKey.title: Ardoq ID
componentKey.description: The component key can be used to uniquely refer to a component in a more human-readable way, and is searchable in the application.

color.title: Component Color
color.description: Color is a style attribute used by the front-end to display the component color in views like the block diagram. By default this will use the color defined by the component-type, but can be overriden by setting it explicitly per-component.

additionalProperties.title: Value
additionalProperties.description: The value of a custom field.

customFields.title: Custom Fields
customFields.description: A custom field is a key/value pair that is not intrinsic to the ardoq model.

icon.title: Component Icon
icon.description: Icon is a style attribute used by the front-end to display the component icon in views like the block diagram. By default this will use the icon defined by the component-type, but can be overriden by setting it explicitly per-component. A list of valid values for this attribute should be found by inspecting the style drop-down in the front-end.

href.title: href
href.description: A URI that can be used to retrieve the next set of paginated results.

next.title: Next
next.description: A link to the next page in a paginated result.

_links.title: Links
_links.description: Links related to the paginated results.

_meta.title: Metadata
_meta.description: Metadata related to the paginated response.

parameters.name: rootWorkspace
parameters.description: The ardoq identifier of the workspace that the component belongs to.

parameters.name: parent
parameters.description: The parent identifier of the component.

parameters.name: componentKey
parameters.description: Referred to as the 'Ardoq ID' in the App

parameters.name: typeId
parameters.description: The type identifier of the component.

get.description:
List all components. Query parameters can be used to retrieve a subset of the collection. All included query parameters are interpreted as forming a logical **conjunction**, meaning that only the components that satisfy every property will be returned. The list endpoint supports searching for custom fields. When searching for a custom field, the value is interpreted based on the type associated with the field. This means that you are not required to _quote_ strings. To include a **custom field** in your search, you should specify the JSON path. For example; if you wanted to search for all components that have the **name** "Ardoq" and the **custom field** `my_field` with a boolean value of `true` you would use the query param:

```name=Ardoq&customFields.my_field=true```
